description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in D√ºsseldorf's Heart" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in D√ºsseldorf's Heart

places.generalDescription: Rheinuferpromenade in D√ºsseldorf is a bustling riverfront promenade that offers a picturesque escape along the scenic banks of the Rhine River. This charming stretch invites visitors to walk, skate, or cycle while enjoying panoramic views of the river and city skyline. Lined with parks, cafes, and leisure areas, it's a popular hangout for locals and tourists alike. The nearby D√ºsseldorfer Kasematten features various dining options and connects directly to the Old Town.
places.name: Rheinuferpromenade D√ºsseldorf

reviews.text:
Beautiful place to walk around.
There are benches around by where you can sit and relax with amazing river views.

I will post a full video on my YouTube, the channel name is ‚ÄòTravel with Rameez'
It's a very beautiful walk. You can sit outside and watch the sunset or you can dine in one of the restaurants downstairs. It's 20-30 minutes walk from shopping centers.

Best place to visit in Dusseldorf. Skyline during sunset and sunrise looks amazing and magical along with the majestic scrappers and towers. Lively place with so much out door activities to do.  Cruising and dining option is a topping on ice.

places.generalDescription: Classic Remise D√ºsseldorf is a unique venue located in a converted warehouse in Dusseldorf, Germany. It serves as a hub for classic car enthusiasts, offering a variety of attractions such as classic car showrooms, repair and restoration facilities, parts shops, auto storage spaces, and stores selling auto-related clothing and gifts. The venue also features glass storage 'boxes' where owners can securely store their cars while still making them visible to visitors.

sources.snippet: You're sure to fall in love all over again at the Classic Remise D√ºsseldorf. This car enthusiast's dream is located in the Wersten district, housed in a landmark building filled with historic charm. We were astounded by their amazing collection of classic and luxury automobiles, some worth millions of euros!
sources.shortName: 16 Romantic Things To Do In Dusseldorf For Couples [February 2025]

places.name: Classic Remise D√ºsseldorf

reviews.text: Super cool car exhibition, and entrance is completely free!! Great spot for cool pictures. The facility has a restaurant to eat and have a drink. It also offers cool experiences like f1 simulators. There is also a very cool store where you can buy racing caps, jackets, etc. 100% I would recommend this place.

I love this place. Each time I visited D√ºsseldorf, I was there too. It is paradise of car enthusiasts. If you love car as me. Do not miss this place.
It is one the best place to buy classic or sport cars.

I love this place. We come from Belgium and we love oldtimer cars. Every time we see all these beautiful car on the road. They always have German license plate and I love seeing them.

Today we got a chance to visit it here and I was so so so happy. All these cars are amazing. It's really like a dream for a lot of people to see all these beautiful cars.

It's a really nice place to visit and definitely gave me more inspiration to save money to own one of this in the future! ü§£

But really I love this place so muchü•∫

places.generalDescription: Schloss Benrath, also known as Benrath Palace, is a stunning 18th-century pink palace showcasing the Baroque architectural style. The palace features original interiors and is surrounded by ornate gardens and a picturesque lake. Visitors can explore two museums within the palace: the Museum of European Garden Art and the Museum of Natural History, which house an impressive collection of sculptures, artwork, paintings, and artifacts from the 18th century.

sources.snippet: Benrath Palace is an 18th-century pink ornate palace that is considered to be a fine example of Baroque style of architecture. The two museums in the palace ‚Äì Museum of European Garden Art and the Museum of Natural History ‚Äì house an admirable collection of sculptures, artwork, paintings, and other artifacts from the 18th century, which would delight any couple interested in history. Afterwards, you can take a romantic stroll in the immaculately maintained, 61-hectare formal English gardens punctuated by ponds, fountains, flowerbeds, herb gardens and broad walkways shaded by tall trees.
sources.shortName: The Best Spots To Take A Date In Dsseldorf

sources.snippet: Sweep your sweetheart off their feet with a idyllic day trip to Schloss Benrath, a fairytale-like palace in the outskirts of D√ºsseldorf. Wandering hand in hand through the majestic garden is ideal for couples ‚Äî unlike the crowded city, the garden offers ample space for privacy, allowing you to savor moments together in peace. Couples who enjoy history and architecture may find exploring the lavishly decorated rooms and halls inside the palace to be captivating too.
sources.shortName: 16 Romantic Things To Do In Dusseldorf For Couples [February 2025]

places.name: Schloss Benrath

reviews.text:
Free entry to the gorgeous park grounds surrounding the 18th century palace.

From highly manicured French gardens to a naturalistic English garden, from shaded paths along wilderness to a decent-sized playground, this place has something for all ages.

It will give you the illusion of being on the set of historical shows or movies.

The caf√© is worth a visit. Just the view is worth every penny. I consider the drink and housemade cake a free throw-in.

I had a wonderful experience visiting the castle - it's absolutely beautiful and rich with history. The gardens surrounding the castle are stunning and very well maintained, and the best part is they are free to enter. There's a lovely caf√© nearby that serves excellent coffee and delicious cakes, perfect for a relaxing break.

I highly recommend purchasing your tickets online - not only is it more convenient, but they're also a euro cheaper than buying them at the ticket counter. It's also a good idea to arrive an hour or two earlier than your ticket time so you can take a leisurely stroll through the gardens. The area is peaceful, with plenty of birds to watch - a real treat for nature lovers.

The ticket also includes access to two nearby museums: the Museum of Garden Styles and another dedicated to the region's flora and fauna. Overall, it's a fantastic day out, blending history, nature, and a bit of culture. Highly recommend!

this place is SO pretty, worth the 12‚Ç¨, definitely. easy to find, very organised, very beautiful, the guy who checked my ticket spoke kinda fast so I couldn't really understand what he said but as long as you wear the slippers, take pictures without flash, not touch stuff, not eat and be relatively quiet you'll be fine (basically respect the place). also definitely scan the QR code and listen to the guide taking you through the rooms, it adds a lot to the experience !

sources.snippet: Among its five permanent collections are the Kunstpalast‚Äôs picture gallery, featuring European paintings from the 15th to 20th centuries ‚Äì including Peter Paul Rubens‚Äôs magnificent ‚ÄòVenus and Adonis‚Äô  ‚Äì and the modern gallery, with an impressive array of German Expressionist paintings. If you don‚Äôt think looking at glass would be all that interesting, this museum‚Äôs collection will change your mind. More than 3,000 pieces, dating from Roman times through the Middle Ages and Art Nouveau period and up to the present, is one of the most impressive in the world.
sources.shortName: 19 Best Things To Do in D√ºsseldorf, Picked By Experts

sources.snippet: A 15-minute walk from the Old Town, the Kunstpalast Museum is D√ºsseldorf‚Äôs fine arts museum. (There are actually four or five major art museums all within walking distance of each other, but I was most excited by the exhibitions at the Kunstpalast).
sources.shortName: What to Do, See & Eat in D√ºsseldorf, Germany

sources.snippet: The Kunstpalast is currently showing his works in dialog with works from the D√ºsseldorf School of Painting. Due to the lockdown, it is not possible to visit the museum, but you can get to know some of the exhibits via an audio guide.
sources.shortName: Romantic places in D√ºsseldorf

reviews.text: I enjoyed the museum alot. They have a great mix of art collections. From old paintings to modern ones and a good mix of different kind of art. Totally recommend a visit if you are in Dusseldorf.

This museum  has an impressive collection with a mix of classical and modern art, but the overall experience was somewhat underwhelming. Some exhibits were captivating, others felt a bit underwhelming. The layout of the museum can be confusing, making it hard to navigate.  It's worth a visit for art enthusiasts.
Quite a big museum with a variety of styles in paintings. Also some other objects like sculptures and vases. Also a good restaurant inside, quite busy, but very good king pawn spaghetti.

places.generalDescription: Nord Park is a well-known and expansive park in Dusseldorf, featuring themed gardens, fountains, shade trees, and walking paths. It was originally planned for the Reich Exhibition Schaffendes Volk in 1936 and opened in 1937. The park offers broad walkways, biking lanes, waterways, playgrounds, and a famous Japanese Garden.

sources.snippet: For an affordable and romantic date away from the crowds, Nordpark is considered one of the most appealing parks in D√ºsseldorf  for date ideas. You and your beau can stroll through beautiful gardens, watch sunlight dance on sparkling fountains, and chat along shady paths under tall trees... Perfect for romance!
sources.shortName: 16 Romantic Things To Do In Dusseldorf For Couples [February 2025]

sources.snippet: There are many different parks throughout D√ºsseldorf, though Nordpark is one of the city‚Äôs most popular attractions. It also makes for a great starting point for a relaxed and romantic evening.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Dusseldorf

places.name: Nord Park

reviews.text:
Very beautiful, huge  and well kept park. The fountains are very mesmerising. Many benches to relax. Great children play areas on both sides.

Just a tip, walk few metres from entrance n turn right for fountains if you are not able to walk much.
Is a beautiful park to just unwind and soak up the sun, or just enjoy some quiet time. Easy to get to
Nice place to relax and enjoying a quiet afternoon in the shade or sun if you want to catch up on it. The japanese garden at the back is pretty nice and the atmosphere is calming.

places.generalDescription: The Rhine Tower, also known as Rheinturm, is a must-visit attraction in Dusseldorf. This futuristic tower features an observation deck and a revolving restaurant offering stunning city views. Situated on the banks of the Rhine River near Media Harbor, it provides a unique dining experience with a 360-degree panorama of the city skyline from nearly 170 meters above ground. Designed by architect H.

sources.snippet: At 218 metres, this is the city‚Äôs tallest building, and one of the more sophisticated of D√ºsseldorf attractions. Head here during the day for 360 degree panoramic views from the dizzyingly high observation deck, or enjoy a dinner reservation at sunset directly overlooking the Rhine. Once dusk falls, the tower lights up to display the time down the side.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Dusseldorf

places.name: Rhine Tower

reviews.text:
D√ºsseldorf with a group of four friends. We booked our tickets online in advance, which made the process quick and easy. When we arrived, everything was well organized. It took about 30 minutes to get up to the observation deck, including waiting time and the elevator ride, which wasn't too bad at all.

Once we got to the top, the view was absolutely worth it. You can see the entire city of D√ºsseldorf from up there, including the Rhine River, old town, and beyond. It wasn't too crowded when we went, which made the experience more relaxing and enjoyable. We had plenty of space to take photos and enjoy the scenery without feeling rushed or overwhelmed.

There's also a nice restaurant and bar at the top. The atmosphere was calm and modern, and it's a great spot if you want to enjoy a drink or snack while admiring the view. Prices are a bit higher, as expected for a tourist spot, but the experience makes up for it.

Overall, visiting the Rhine Tower was a highlight of our trip. I definitely recommend it for anyone spending time in D√ºsseldorf.

Good value, great views. Liked the slanted windows- perfect for placing your phone against at just the right angle. It was also half the price of the Euro tower in Amsterdam, which had worse views. Go before midday! It's cheaper then

Great sight seeing attraction when in Dusseldorf. At 168 meters high the panorama restaurant offers great views of the city, surrounding cities and landscape and the nearby boats navigating the rhine river.
Highly recommend booking ticket in advance, as even in off-holidays season its sometimes sold out.

places.generalDescription: EK≈å-Haus der Japanischen Kultur e.V. is a cultural center and temple that offers an immersive experience into Japanese culture. The center features traditional Japanese architecture, serene gardens with charming bridges, and a Shin-Buddhist temple - one of the few in Europe. Visitors can enjoy guided tours, attend special events and ceremonies, or simply explore the beautiful Japanese garden.

sources.snippet: If the idea of experiencing a new, exotic culture together excites you, EK≈å-Haus der Japanischen Kultur is the perfect idea for a unique date. This little oasis in the middle of the city celebrates Japanese culture, and consists of a traditional temple and house and acres of beautiful walkways punctuated by adorable bridges. They offer guided tours and invite visitors to attend special events and ceremonies.
sources.shortName: The Best Spots To Take A Date In Dsseldorf

places.name: EK≈å-Haus der Japanischen Kultur e.V.

reviews.text:
Beautiful place with a lot of folks not respecting the tranquility of the area. Human beings...

Reminded me of overcrowded place in Japan. Fortunately this time it was rainy, so it was quiet and not crowded.

The visit is free, and if you go there, please be quiet, enjoy the calm and respect yourself üôèüèª
We went on a week day on April 8th, it was quiet and peaceful. The temple inside was so calmer and over all it was a beautiful place to visit during spring season

I loved the peaceful moment I had there!

They don't work on weekends. They also don't work on Monday. So, make sure to go any other day if you want to visit the garden. The visit to the garden is free, the only requirement is not to be loud, as to not disturb the peace.

You can visit the museum for 3.5‚Ç¨ as of May 2025, not sure about prices later.

In the museum, you have the bottom hall which explores the Japanese letters, and the explanation is given in German, if you don't know it or don't have someone to explain, then you are not going to enjoy that part. The second part of the museum is when you have to take off your shoes and wear the white socks, then you explore traditional Japanese house. If you are young(er), you'll probably geek out like I did. You can keep or throw socks to trash.

I went solo but if you want to relax you'll need like 30-50mins for both the Garden and Museum.

And also I'd like to thank the receptionist at the desk in museum for being very kind and sweet. Arigato gozaimas! ü•π

places.generalDescription: Glowing Rooms Dusseldorf offers a unique indoor mini-golf experience with a twist. The course is illuminated by blacklight, and players are provided with special 3-D glasses to enhance the fun. The rounds are challenging and entertaining, as the 3-D glasses bring the room to life, making it difficult to identify obstacles and adding an extra layer of enjoyment. Additionally, iPods are provided for teams to keep track of scores.

sources.snippet: Here's a cute date night idea: How about playing glow-in-the-dark mini-golf together?. It doesn't matter if you're not a pro golfer, because it's all about having fun and seeing if your date is up for a little friendly competition. Plus, mini-golf is a great way to focus on each other without any distractions, like phones or awkward silences.
sources.shortName: 16 Romantic Things To Do In Dusseldorf For Couples [February 2025]

places.name: Glowing Rooms Dusseldorf

reviews.text: Really enjoyed coming here. Their phone marking system is really good, the paint and affects look amazing and add a slight level of difficulty to the games too. They serve drinks and there's cup holders on the walls around the whole place. The staff were super friendly too. Loved visiting here :)

We visited this place for my birthday.
The staff was super nice, during the time there were some strong Corona rules and the place made sure to maintain them so everyone was safe and comfortable.
The place is super clean, very good artwork and effects. My favourite holes are the last ones, the light there is darker so it is very fun to figure out the obstacles.
Fun for all ages.
Surprisingly fun. They've made mini golf great again. The place is very well kept - everything is clean and crisp. Highly recommended.

places.generalDescription: Vabali Spa D√ºsseldorf is a haven for relaxation and rejuvenation, nestled in the natural surroundings of Elbsee. The expansive spa features ten saunas, including panoramic and herbal options, as well as two steam rooms and a laconium. The authentic Balinese-inspired architecture sets the stage for complete tranquility, with rituals and ceremonies enhancing the serene atmosphere. This Southeast Asian-themed retreat offers an array of massages and treatments, from coconut-mint peels to Ayurvedic massages.

sources.snippet: With 10 saunas, two steam baths, a laconium, two pools and numerous relaxation areas right in the middle of nature, vabali spa D√ºsseldorf is relaxation center where the body, mind, and soul can recover.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Dusseldorf

sources.snippet: For the tired couple, a spa retreat is just what the doctor ordered. It's a great way for you and your date to kick back, relax, and get back in sync. My favorite place to unwind is Vabali Spa.
sources.shortName: 16 Romantic Things To Do In Dusseldorf For Couples [February 2025]

places.name: Vabali Spa D√ºsseldorf

reviews.text:
This place is truly heaven on Earth and an absolute must-visit! The breathtaking lake view is extraordinary, creating a serene and relaxing atmosphere. With over 16 different types of saunas, each offering unique features, it's an unparalleled wellness experience.

The staff are incredibly friendly and supportive, always willing to assist, and they make an effort to explain everything in English. A special shoutout to the gentleman at the entrance-he was extremely respectful and accommodating, even though we arrived without a reservation. Keep in mind that reservations are essential on weekends, as the place is massive yet still gets quite crowded.

Unfortunately, taking photos of the stunning view isn't allowed since phones are prohibited, but trust me, it's a sight to behold! The food is on another level-highly recommend the ramen and the Vabali burger. And for dessert, don't miss the New York cheesecake; it's simply divine!

Definitely recommend making a reservation, even on a weekday. I debated on doing a massage, so I passed on reserving one, but regretted my decision when I got there. I asked if any were available, but they were fully booked, especially since I went on a Friday late afternoon, and it was super busy.

This was probably one of my favorites in Germany. The infinity pool with the amazing sunset was perfect, it appears to be near a lake. So calm. There's an indoor pool as well, several saunas that have the temp & and humidity. I don't think a jacuzzi unless I missed it.

I loved the outside gardens, with lounge chairs. Very relaxing. I got a cappuccino & a brownie cake, delicious. 2 hours with my snacks was less than 50‚Ç¨...

I was disappointed at the amount of people who snuck their phone in their robes, there was a group that was also taking pics from the top deck into the pool. Huge NO, NO... especially since everyone in their birthday suits.

Otherwise, I highly recommend it! The sunset was amazing that evening.

The place is really nice decorated but insane busy‚Ä¶ we just went out (sunday of march) and we liked (equipment, decoration) but we think it is not worth it the money.

We paid 3,5‚Ç¨ to reserve a place but still really busy‚Ä¶ so why we should pay a reservation if still there are waiting lines to enter or to acces to the sauna.

Moreover, our plan was to have breakfast there but the waiting line also was really long.  Important to know that the restaurant is inside the spa, so the time you spend waiting is also added on the time of the spa (you pay for hours‚Ä¶ so perfect business‚Ä¶).

A SPA is to relax but with so many people is not really possible.

Also a friend opened the locker, leave the bracalet (pass) next to him, and when he finnish changing, the bracalet was not there‚Ä¶

Important information we would like to know in addvance:
-is allowed to bring your bottle of water, so you can refilled. Otherwise 3‚Ç¨ for a small bottle.
-the parking from the spa cost 1,5‚Ç¨
-is textil free so you must go nacked
-It is 25' by car from Dusseldorf center

I guess if you are there maybe for a weekend the experience is different‚Ä¶ or maybe during weekdays is less busy‚Ä¶ I do not know, but if you pay 3,5‚Ç¨ (on top of the final price) in addvance to book a spot, what it is not acceptable is that then there you still need to do long waiting lines.

Hope this aspects get improved because it is a really nice place.

places.generalDescription: The Grafenberg Forest is a lush green forest home to various animal species, including deer, wild boars, and foxes. Visitors are allowed to feed raw vegetables and apples to the animals, drawing excited squeals from the little ones.

sources.snippet: Wrapped up warm, with hot drinks and blankets in your luggage, you can enjoy the "beautiful view" of D√ºsseldorf in Grafenberg Forest.
sources.shortName: Romantic places in D√ºsseldorf

places.name: Grafenberg Forest

reviews.text: It is a lovely place, I would totally recommend it to fo for a walk, run or some serious sport training

Spend a wonderful day at the park, for a short walk it a few hours. This forest is a natural reserve in the city, wild but with easy access and well maintained trails. The tree are so old, variety of species it was such an amazing walk. There are water fountains along the way with drinkable mountain water.
Super place for everyone , we loved strolling around the place. It was so peaceful and beautiful. Kids can have fun seeing animals and enjoy in the park . Would definitely recommend it to othersüòä

places.generalDescription: Medienhafen Dusseldorf e.V. is a must-visit destination for architecture enthusiasts and culture lovers. Once a rundown commercial port, it has been revitalized into a vibrant hub for media, fashion, and creative industries. The area showcases an intriguing blend of old warehouses alongside modern architectural marvels by renowned architects like Frank Gehry and David Chipperfield.

sources.snippet: You can stroll the laid-back Rheinufer promenade south along the Rhine River from the Old Town all the way to MedienHafen, a revamped docklands neighborhood that‚Äôs become home to the city‚Äôs most creative modern buildings. Beyond the Rheinkniebr√ºcke (suspension bridge), the Rheinturm (Rhine TV Tower) has become a city icon since it went up in 1981 (it‚Äôs still the tallest building in D√ºsseldorf). Today you can zip 558ft (168 meters) up to the observation deck above the river, or check out its revolving restaurant and cocktail bar.
sources.shortName: WHERE TO STAY in DUSSELDORF

sources.snippet: Hanging out at the industrial-chic Medienhafen makes for a unique date idea for couples looking for something different to do!. In fact, its cool mix of old and new architecture is a fantastic backdrop for impromptu photos or selfies together. The top photo spot is in front of Frank Gehry's  Neuer Zollhof towers.
sources.shortName: 16 Romantic Things To Do In Dusseldorf For Couples [February 2025]
What to Do, See & Eat in D√ºsseldorf, Germany

places.name: Medienhafen Dusseldorf e.V.

reviews.text: Great views, good for walk. To avoid crowd visit on Sunday. Unique buildings.
A great place to visit if its in the middle of the week,weekend is just full of tourist and many more. Try to visit during weekdays then you can enjoy more the view and have a lot of space.

The Rheinturm is definitely a must-see in D√ºsseldorf! From the top, you get a breathtaking panoramic view of the entire city. It's a unique experience, especially around sunset. You can also find a guide if you'd like to learn more about what you're seeing. There's a restaurant at the top as well-perfect for enjoying dinner with a stunning view. Highly recommended

places.address: c/o TIGGES Rechtsanw√§lte, Zollhof 8, 40219 D√ºsseldorf, Germany

places.generalDescription: Brewery Schumacher, located just east of the Altstadt in Dusseldorf, is known for brewing its beer since the Second World War. The brewery offers a variety of brews for visitors to taste, including their famous Schumacher Alt beer brewed from an old family recipe dating back to 1838. The rustic yet warm interior and spacious biergarten provide a cozy atmosphere for enjoying authentic food and delicious beer.

sources.shortName: 30 Delicious and Exciting Things to Do in Dusseldorf, Germany

places.name: Brewery Schumacher

reviews.text:
Famous beer brewery in D√ºsseldorf that brew the Alt beer!

Our European beer and Christmas market guide took us here after our lunch at another brewery just to try different Alt style beer from different breweries!

The Alt beer here are bit lighter then the other two we try! I have to d say that I am not a dark beer person but this one was very good!  Not very hoppy but with very good flavor and body to it!

What I really like to do if God permits me to come back to D√ºsseldorf again, I will love to have a meal here! Because those dishes passing by our table, look incredibly delicious!

And their beer glass is only 5.50 Euro for the set of two!

Had a great time at Schumacher in D√ºsseldorf! The Altbier was smooth and full of flavor, one of the best I've tried. Paired it with their bratwurst, which was perfectly cooked and super tasty. Great atmosphere, friendly service, and a true local gem. Would definitely come back!

We visited for lunch.
We weren't very hungry, so we shared a sausage platter and some potatoes. The seasoning was quite strong, but we really enjoyed the authentic sausages and beer.

The atmosphere of the restaurant was great, and it felt very comfortable.

The outdoor seating was full, but the inside was quiet, so we were able to get a table right away.

When our child started crying, the staff kindly brought over a picture book and even gave us some candy.
Everyone was so friendly, and we really appreciated it.

places.generalDescription: Kaiserpfalz Kaiserswerth is a 12th-century castle located in Dusseldorf, with picturesque views of the river and countryside. The palace has a rich history dating back to the 10th century and has witnessed centuries of wars, conquests, and destruction. Although mostly in ruins today, the castle still exudes romance and charm. Visitors can explore its thick walls, staircases, and ancient windows while enjoying views of the river.

sources.snippet: The earliest existence of Kaiserpfalz dates back to the 10th century, and the palace still stands as a witness to all these centuries of history, wars, conquests and destruction. Though most of it is today in ruins, the romance lurking in Emperor Barbarossa‚Äòs palace is undeniable. An afternoon spent exploring its amazingly thick walls, staircases, ancient windows and gazing out toward the river is bound to be delightful.
sources.shortName: The Best Spots To Take A Date In Dsseldorf

places.name: Kaiserpfalz Kaiserswerth

reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful historical site! The ruins of the Kaiserpfalz are stunning and full of atmosphere. You can really feel the rich history while walking through the old stone walls and archways. It's a peaceful place to explore, with wonderful views of the Rhine River nearby. The surrounding village of Kaiserswerth is charming too, with lovely cafes and cobblestone streets. A perfect spot for a relaxing afternoon or a quiet, scenic stroll. Highly recommended for history lovers and anyone looking for a unique experience near D√ºsseldorf!

The ruins of this medieval imperial castle on the banks of the Rhine are one of the most atmospheric spots near D√ºsseldorf. Built in the 11th century, it once served as a residence for Emperor Frederick Barbarossa. Even in ruins, the scale and presence of the site are impressive.

It's a very picturesque place: perfect for a peaceful walk along the river, exploring the old stone walls and arches, and enjoying the scenic views. Nearby, the charming historic town of Kaiserswerth offers cozy caf√©s and narrow cobbled streets.

Highly recommended for history lovers or anyone looking to experience a touch of the past in a tranquil setting.

Beautiful castle ruins to visit, we rented some bikes in Dusseldorf and bikes along the Rhine to get here which was a lovely day trip. Worth the visit, there's some other cool building to walk around and see in the area as well.

places.generalDescription: Rheinuferpromenade, located on the right bank of the Rhine in Dusseldorf, is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike. The promenade offers a picturesque walkway that stretches from the Parliament down to the harbor, providing ample sunshine throughout the day. Since 1993, when road traffic was redirected underground, visitors have been able to enjoy a peaceful stroll along the river.

sources.snippet: The Rheinuferpromenade bordering the Altstadt along the Rhine is one of D√ºsseldorf‚Äôs most popular meeting places. People enjoy the sunshine in one of the many bistros and restaurants or board a boat for a trip on the Rhine.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Dusseldorf, Germany

places.name: Rheinuferpromenade

reviews.text:
Wonderful view of Rhine river while taking a walk along promenade and just enjoying the drink at the bar on the side of promenade.
Many visitors during the weekend. The city has some different spots of the view from the modern architecture as well as the old part besides the unique Japanese quarter Little Tokyo and Germany's most famous shopping miles K√∂.
It was amazing and than all the cafes, local beer and shopping

It is a nice place to walk ,have some coffee, and enjoy seeing the river, I would like to repeat the experience.

I advise you to visit the place.

Khalid

places.generalDescription: Dusseldorf's Rhine Embankment Promenade is a delightful spot to unwind and take in the city's scenic views. Opened in 1997, it offers a pleasant walk with vistas of the Rhine River, bridges, and passing boats. Visitors can also relax at nearby restaurants and bars or cycle along the river. The promenade provides a comfortable place to stroll while enjoying both the river view and the old city.

sources.snippet: River Rhine is the lifeline of D√ºsseldorf, and the Rhine promenade is perhaps the most beautiful, liveliest area of the city. Couples love strolling the promenade or lazing on the steps watching cruise ships go by, and perhaps catching a glorious sunset. You can‚Äôt beat this area as far as gastronomic options are concerned.
sources.shortName: The Best Spots To Take A Date In Dsseldorf

sources.snippet: As the sun disappears behind the Art Nouveau facades of Oberkassel and the buildings on the Rhine embankment promenade glow in soft light, the atmosphere on Burgplatz is particularly atmospheric. The two pillar saints, who also enjoy the view of the temporarily erected Ferris wheel, agree.
sources.shortName: Romantic places in D√ºsseldorf

sources.snippet: The edge of the Old Town butts up against the Rhine River, and a promenade stretches from the Old Town down to the MedienHafen and is the perfect place for a sunset stroll.
sources.shortName: What to Do, See & Eat in D√ºsseldorf, Germany

places.name: Rhine embankment promenade

reviews.text: Amazing promenade with a lot of cafes and restaurants.
Lovely place to take a stroll or to just hang up with loved ones. It is very close to shopping area and has lots of Caf√©s and restaurants. Best of all is the breathtaking view, especially at sunset.
Very nice area to enjoy walking/running or just relaxing in a side bench.

places.generalDescription: Unterbacher See is a popular destination in Dusseldorf, offering a perfect setting for a leisurely day out. Visitors can enjoy strolls along the sandy beaches, take a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear waters, or indulge in sailing activities. The lake also provides various recreational options such as beach volleyball, pedal boats, surfing, and mini-golf. For those seeking relaxation, there are waterfront restaurants and cafes to unwind.

sources.snippet: Unterbacher See is a great idea for a relaxed date at D√ºsseldorf‚Äôs very own lake beach, Unterbacher See. The beach has soft sand and barbecue facilities, making it a perfect place for a cozy picnic. To add to the fun, you can always go swimming boating, hiking, or biking here.
sources.shortName: The Best Spots To Take A Date In Dsseldorf

places.name: Unterbacher See

reviews.text: It's a well organised, super fun place where you can rent boats, have food and sit by the water. If you don't want to rent boats/ go swimming, you can also take a 6km hike around the water and see really beautiful views. A must visit on a sunny day!

‚≠êPedal boating on the lake is such a fun family activity. Remember to bring cash. This is how renting a boat works:
1. You pay down 25 euro upfront, as a security deposit.
2. You get a chip with a number on it. This is the the number of your boat.
3. After you hand in the numbered chip at the return, a total price will be calculated and deducted from the 25 you paid down. You get your change in cash.

‚≠êOur 60-min boating of a two seater costs 12 euro. Another two seater at 74 minutes costs 14.80 euro.

‚≠êFour seaters are in shorter supply and higher demand, so the wait is longer. It's always a good idea to get in the line early. We waited for about 20 minutes for the two-seaters.

Unterbacher See is great if you've got children and are looking for the convenience of having bathrooms and snack bars, but I found the 4 Euro entrance fee a little high. It costs 6 Euro a day to rent a beach chair on top of that. Nonetheless, I will definitely come back when I'm with friends and looking to play some beach volleyball or tan nude! Otherwise, I'll probably find a more secluded lake!
